title: Create verify script and hello module
intent: Create scripts/verify.sh that runs 'python -m compileall -q .' and create hello.py with a function greet() that returns the string 'Hello, World!'.
forbidden: Do not create any files other than scripts/verify.sh and hello.py
acceptance_commands: python -c "from hello import greet; assert greet() == 'Hello, World!'"
notes: scripts/verify.sh must start with '#!/usr/bin/env bash' followed by 'set -euo pipefail' and then 'python -m compileall -q .'. hello.py defines exactly one function: greet() -> str that returns 'Hello, World!'.
